cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 157 (Wednesday, September 27, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CURTIS:H.R. 5743.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2The single subject of this legislation is:operation of National Park Service assets during aGovernment shutdown.[Page H4714]

item.title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Interior to repay States for amounts expended by States to operate units of the National Park System during a Government shutdown.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

cdata.text: This bill requires the Department of the Interior to repay states for amounts expended to operate units of the National Park System during a government shutdown.

bill.title: To require the Secretary of the Interior to repay States for amounts expended by States to operate units of the National Park System during a Government shutdown.

item.title: To require the Secretary of the Interior to repay States for amounts expended by States to operate units of the National Park System during a Government shutdown.
To require the Secretary of the Interior to repay States for amounts expended by States to operate units of the National Park System during a Government shutdown.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
